alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 1:55PM CST until February 07 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge affecting Montgomery County. .Recent heavy rainfall will lead to flooding on the Catoma Creek and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by late tonight, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Residential and street flooding becomes a problem...and increases rapidly above 24 feet. Several residences are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 23.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
